name: Parent Relief
description: Recognises individuals who are supporting their parents, grandparents, parents-in-law or grandparents-in-law in Singapore.
benefits: $9,000 tax relief per dependant (for taxpayers staying with dependants)

eligibility.description: Your dependant was 55 years of age and above in 2023
Your dependant did not have an annual income of more than $4,000 in year 2023
Your dependant was living with you in the same household in Singapore
No other relevant reliefs have been claimed on your dependant

nextSteps:
**1. Consider if your dependant is eligible for Parent Relief (Disability)**  
- This provides $14,000 in tax relief per dependant (for taxpayers staying with dependants)  
- Requires an additional form to be submitted and documentation of disability  
2. Re-file tax claims for year 2023  
  
**2. Email IRAS with the following details:**  
- Year of Assessment that you wish to claim the relief: 2023  
- Dependant's  
         - Name: LINDA CHAN TING WEI  
         - NRIC: S1234567A  
         - Date of birth: 30/12/1993  
         - Address: BLK 663 Changi Dr 23 02-48 S123045  
         - Annual income: $65,123.00  
- Confirmation that you have met the qualifying conditions (e.g. Dependent’s Notice of Assessment (NOA))

name: Caregivers Training Grant
description: Supports caregivers (family, foreign domestic workers) attending approved courses on providing care.
benefits: Up to $400 in the first year, followed by $200 annually. The amount will be applied directly to offset course fees.

eligibility.description: Care recipient is a Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident
Care recipient is aged 65 and older
Caregiver must be person in charge of caring for the care recipient (this can include family members and foreign domestic workers)
The full grant quantum has not been claimed by other family members or caregivers
Selected course is on the approved list of courses

nextSteps:
**1. Confirm the auto-populated fields and complete the rest of the Caregiver Training Grant form [here](https://www.aic.sg/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/CTG-Application-form.pdf).**  
Be sure to provide the requested documents:  
- Care Recipient’s NRIC / Birth Certificate  
- Caregiver's NRIC  
  
**2. Select an approved course from the list [here](https://training-healthcare.vertis.digital/)**  
and provide the completed form to the training provider at least 2 weeks before the course begins.

name: Home Caregiving Grant
description: Defrays caregiving costs for eligible individuals with permanent moderate disability living in the community.

eligibility.description: Care recipient is a Singapore Citizen (SC)
Care recipient must always require some assistance with at least 3 Activities of Daily Living, as certified via a Functional Assessment Report
Household monthly income per person is $2,800 or less as determined through Means Testing
Care recipient is not in a residential long-term care institution (e.g. nursing home)

nextSteps:
**1. Complete Means Testing [here](https://www.homes.gov.sg/eservice/) to verify your eligibility.**  
  
**2. Obtain a [Functional Assessment Report](https://www.aic.sg/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Functional-Assessment-Report.pdf)**  
from your GP or care provider. The cost of the Report will vary from provider to provider.  
  
**3. Apply for the Home Caregiving Grant [here](https://cp.efinance.aic.sg/)**  
when steps 1 and 2 are completed and your eligibility has been confirmed.
